text: How do you do?
title: Fantasia

text: My name is Deems Taylor,
title: Fantasia

text: and it's my very pleasant dutyto welcome you here
title: Fantasia

text: on behalf of Walt Disney,Leopold Stokowski
title: Fantasia

text: and all the other artists and musicianswhose combined talents
title: Fantasia

text: went into the creation of thisnew form of entertainment, Fantasia.
title: Fantasia

text: What you're going to see
title: Fantasia

text: are the designsand pictures and stories
title: Fantasia

text: that music inspiredin the minds and imaginations
title: Fantasia

text: of a group of artists.
title: Fantasia

text: In other words,these are not going to be
title: Fantasia

text: the interpretationsof trained musicians.
title: Fantasia

text: Which I think is all to the good.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, there are three kinds of musicon this Fantasia program.
title: Fantasia

text: First is the kind that tellsa definite story.
title: Fantasia

text: Then there's the kind that,while it has no specific plot,
title: Fantasia

text: does paint a series of, more or less,definite pictures.
title: Fantasia

text: Then there's a third kind,
title: Fantasia

text: music that exists simplyfor its own sake.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, the number that opensour Fantasia program,
title: Fantasia

text: the Toccata and Fugue,is music of this third kind,
title: Fantasia

text: what we call absolute music.
title: Fantasia

text: Even the title has no meaning beyonda description of the form of the music.
title: Fantasia

text: What you will see on the screen is apicture of the various abstract images
title: Fantasia

text: that might pass through your mind
title: Fantasia

text: if you sat in a concert halllistening to this music.
title: Fantasia

text: At first you're more or lessconscious of the orchestra.
title: Fantasia

text: So our picture openswith a series of impressions
title: Fantasia

text: of the conductor and the players.
title: Fantasia

text: Then the music begins to suggestother things to your imagination.
title: Fantasia

text: They might be, oh, just masses of color.
title: Fantasia

text: Or they may be cloud formsor great landscapes
title: Fantasia

text: or vague shadows or geometrical objectsfloating in space.
title: Fantasia

text: So now we present
title: Fantasia

text: the Toccata and Fugue in D Minorby Johann Sebastian Bach,
title: Fantasia

text: interpreted in picturesby Walt Disney and his associates,
title: Fantasia

text: and in musicby the Philadelphia Orchestra
title: Fantasia

text: and its conductor, Leopold Stokowski.
title: Fantasia

text: You know, it's funny how wrongan artist can be about his own work.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, the one composition ofTchaikovsky's that he really detested
title: Fantasia

text: was his Nutcracker Suite,
title: Fantasia

text: which is probably the mostpopular thing he ever wrote.
title: Fantasia

text: It's a series of dancestaken out of a full-length ballet
title: Fantasia

text: called The Nutcracker
title: Fantasia

text: that he once composedfor the St. Petersburg opera house.
title: Fantasia

text: It wasn't much of a successand nobody performs it nowadays,
title: Fantasia

text: but I'm pretty sure you'll recognize themusic of the Suite when you hear it.
title: Fantasia

text: Incidentally, you won't seeany nutcracker on the screen.
title: Fantasia

text: There's nothing leftof him but the title.
title: Fantasia

text: And now we're going to hear a piece ofmusic that tells a very definite story.
title: Fantasia

text: As a matter of fact, in this case,the story came first
title: Fantasia

text: and the composer wrote the musicto go with it.
title: Fantasia

text: It's a very old story,one that goes back almost 2,000 years.
title: Fantasia

text: A legend about a sorcererwho had an apprentice.
title: Fantasia

text: He was a bright young lad,very anxious to learn the business.
title: Fantasia

text: As a matter of fact,he was a little bit too bright
title: Fantasia

text: because he started practicingsome of the boss's best magic tricks
title: Fantasia

text: before learning how to control them.
title: Fantasia

text: One day, for instance,when he'd been told by his master
title: Fantasia

text: to carry water to fill a cauldron,he had the brilliant idea
title: Fantasia

text: of bringing a broomstick to lifeto carry the water for him.
title: Fantasia

text: Well, this worked very well, at first.
title: Fantasia

text: Unfortunately, however,having forgotten the magic formula
title: Fantasia

text: that would make the broomstickstop carrying the water,
title: Fantasia

text: he found he'd started somethinghe couldn't finish.
title: Fantasia

text: Mr. Stokowski. Mr. Stokowski.
title: Fantasia

text: My congratulations, sir.
title: Fantasia

text: Congratulations to you, Mickey.
title: Fantasia

text: Gee, thanks.
title: Fantasia

text: Well, so long. I'll be seein' ya.
title: Fantasia

text: Goodbye.
title: Fantasia

text: When Igor Stravinsky wrote his ballet,The Rite of Spring...
title: Fantasia

text: I repeat,
title: Fantasia

text: when Igor Stravinsky wrote his ballet,The Rite of Spring,
title: Fantasia

text: his purpose was, in his own words,to "express primitive life."
title: Fantasia

text: And so Walt Disney and his fellowartists have taken him at his word.
title: Fantasia

text: Instead of presenting the balletin its original form,
title: Fantasia

text: as a simple series of tribal dances,they have visualized it as a pageant,
title: Fantasia

text: as the story of the growthof life on Earth.
title: Fantasia

text: And that story,as you're going to see it,
title: Fantasia

text: isn't the productof anybody's imagination.
title: Fantasia

text: It's a coldly accurate reproductionofwhat science thinks went on
title: Fantasia

text: during the first few billion yearsof this planet's existence.
title: Fantasia

text: Science, not art,wrote the scenario of this picture.
title: Fantasia

text: According to science,the first living things here
title: Fantasia

text: were single-celled organisms,
title: Fantasia

text: tiny little white or green blobsof nothing in particular
title: Fantasia

text: that lived under the water.
title: Fantasia

text: And then, as the ages passed,the oceans began to swarm
title: Fantasia

text: with all kinds of marine creatures.
title: Fantasia

text: Finally, after about a billion years,
title: Fantasia

text: certain fish, more ambitiousthan the rest,
title: Fantasia

text: crawled up on land and becamethe first amphibians.
title: Fantasia

text: And then,several hundred million years ago,
title: Fantasia

text: nature went off on another tackand produced the dinosaurs.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, the name "dinosaur"comes from two Greek words
title: Fantasia

text: meaning "terrible lizard."
title: Fantasia

text: And they certainly were all of that.
title: Fantasia

text: They came in all shapes and sizes,
title: Fantasia

text: from little, crawling horrorsabout the size of a chicken
title: Fantasia

text: to hundred-ton nightmares.
title: Fantasia

text: They were not very bright.
title: Fantasia

text: Even the biggest of themhad only the brain of a pigeon.
title: Fantasia

text: They lived in the air and wateras well as on land.
title: Fantasia

text: As a rule, they were vegetarians,
title: Fantasia

text: rather amiableand easy to get along with.
title: Fantasia

text: However, there were bulliesand gangsters among them.
title: Fantasia

text: The worst of the lot,a brute named tyrannosaurus rex,
title: Fantasia

text: was probably the meanest killerthat ever roamed the Earth.
title: Fantasia

text: The dinosaurs were lords of creationfor about 200 million years.
title: Fantasia

text: And then... Well,we don't exactly know what happened.
title: Fantasia

text: Some scientists think thatgreat droughts and earthquakes
title: Fantasia

text: turned the whole worldinto a gigantic dustbowl.
title: Fantasia

text: In any case,the dinosaurs were wiped out.
title: Fantasia

text: That is where our story ends.
title: Fantasia

text: Where it begins is at a timeinfinitely far back,
title: Fantasia

text: when there was no life at all on Earth.
title: Fantasia

text: Nothing but clouds of steam,
title: Fantasia

text: boiling seas and exploding volcanoes.
title: Fantasia

text: So now,imagine yourselves out in space
title: Fantasia

text: billions and billions of years ago,
title: Fantasia

text: looking down on this lonely,tormented little planet,
title: Fantasia

text: spinning throughan empty sea of nothingness.
title: Fantasia

text: And now we'll havea 15-minute intermission.
title: Fantasia

text: Before we get intothe second half of the program,
title: Fantasia

text: I'd like to introduce somebody to you,
title: Fantasia

text: somebody who's very importantto Fantasia.
title: Fantasia

text: He's very shy and very retiring.
title: Fantasia

text: I just happened to run across himone day at the Disney studios.
title: Fantasia

text: But when I did, I suddenly realized
title: Fantasia

text: that here was not only an indispensablemember of the organization,
title: Fantasia

text: but a screen personality whosepossibilities nobody around the place
title: Fantasia

text: had ever noticed.
title: Fantasia

text: And so I'm very happy to havethis opportunity to introduce to you
title: Fantasia

text: the soundtrack.
title: Fantasia

text: All right. Come on.
title: Fantasia

text: That's all right. Don't be timid.
title: Fantasia

text: Atta soundtrack.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, watching him, I discoveredthat every beautiful sound
title: Fantasia

text: also createsan equally beautiful picture.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, look. Will the soundtrackkindly produce a sound?
title: Fantasia

text: Go on, don't be nervous.Go ahead. Any sound.
title: Fantasia

text: Well, that isn't quitewhat I had in mind.
title: Fantasia

text: Suppose we hear and see the harp.
title: Fantasia

text: Now one of the strings, say, the violin.
title: Fantasia

text: And now... now, one of the woodwinds,a flute.
title: Fantasia

text: Very pretty.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, let's have a brass instrument,the trumpet.
title: Fantasia

text: All right. Now, how abouta low instrument, the bassoon?
title: Fantasia

text: Go on. Go on.Drop the other shoe, will you?
title: Fantasia

text: Well, now to finish, suppose we seesome of the percussion instruments,
title: Fantasia

text: beginning with the bass drum.
title: Fantasia

text: Thanks a lot, old man.
title: Fantasia

text: The symphony that Beethovencalled the Pastoral,
title: Fantasia

text: his sixth, is one of the few piecesof music he ever wrote
title: Fantasia

text: that tells somethinglike a definite story.
title: Fantasia

text: He was a great nature lover,and in this symphony,
title: Fantasia

text: he paints a musical pictureof a day in the country.
title: Fantasia

text: Now, of course,the country that Beethoven described
title: Fantasia

text: was the countrysidewith which he was familiar.
title: Fantasia

text: But his music coversa much wider field than that,
title: Fantasia

text: so Walt Disney has given the PastoralSymphony a mythological setting.
title: Fantasia

text: And that setting is of Mt. Olympus,the abode of the gods.
title: Fantasia

text: And here, first of all,we meet a group of fabulous creatures
title: Fantasia

text: of the field and forest,
title: Fantasia

text: unicorns, fauns,Pegasus, the flying horse,
title: Fantasia

text: and his entire family,the centaurs,
title: Fantasia

text: those strange creaturesthat are half-man and half-horse.
title: Fantasia

text: And their girlfriends,the centaur-ettes.
title: Fantasia

text: Later on, we meet our old friend,Bacchus, the god ofwine,
title: Fantasia

text: presiding over a bacchanal.
title: Fantasia

text: The party is interrupted by a storm.
title: Fantasia

text: And now, we see Vulcanforging thunderbolts
title: Fantasia

text: and handing them over to theking of all the gods, Zeus,
title: Fantasia

text: who plays darts with them.
title: Fantasia

text: As the storm clears, we see Iris,the goddess of the rainbow.
title: Fantasia

text: And Apollo, drivinghis sun chariot across the sky.
title: Fantasia

text: And then Morpheus, the god of sleep,
title: Fantasia

text: covers everythingwith his cloak of night,
title: Fantasia

text: as Diana, using the new moon as a bow,
title: Fantasia

text: shoots an arrow of firethat spangles the sky with stars.
title: Fantasia

text: Now we're going to do one of the mostfamous and popular ballets ever written,
title: Fantasia

text: The Dance of the Hoursfrom Ponchielli's opera La Gioconda.
title: Fantasia

text: It's a pageant of the hours of the day.
title: Fantasia

text: We see first a groupof dancers in costumes
title: Fantasia

text: to suggest the delicate light of dawn.
title: Fantasia

text: Then a second group enters
title: Fantasia

text: dressed to representthe brilliant light of noon day.
title: Fantasia

text: As these withdraw, a third group enters
title: Fantasia

text: in costumes that suggestthe delicate tones of early evening.
title: Fantasia

text: Then a last group, all in black,the somber hours of the night.
title: Fantasia

text: Suddenly, the orchestrabursts into a brilliant finale
title: Fantasia

text: in which the hours of darknessare overcome by the hours of light.
title: Fantasia

text: All this takes place in the great hallwith its garden beyond,
title: Fantasia

text: of the palace of Duke Alvise,a Venetian nobleman.
title: Fantasia

text: The last number on our Fantasia program
title: Fantasia

text: is a combination of two piecesof music so utterly different
title: Fantasia

text: in construction and moodthat they set each other off perfectly.
title: Fantasia

text: The firstis A Night on Bald Mountain,
title: Fantasia

text: by one of Russia's greatest composers,Modest Mussorgsky.
title: Fantasia

text: The second is Franz Schubert'sworld-famous Ave Maria.
title: Fantasia

text: Musically and dramatically,we have here a picture
title: Fantasia

text: of the strugglebetween the profane and the sacred.
title: Fantasia

text: Bald Mountain, according to tradition,
title: Fantasia

text: is the gathering placeof Satan and his followers.
title: Fantasia

text: Here on Walpurgis Night, which isthe equivalent of our own Halloween,
title: Fantasia

text: the creatures of evil gatherto worship their master.
title: Fantasia

text: Under his spell, they dance furiously
title: Fantasia

text: until the coming of dawnand the sounds of church bells
title: Fantasia

text: send the infernal army slinking backinto their abodes of darkness.
title: Fantasia

text: And then we hear the Ave Maria,with its message of the triumph
title: Fantasia

text: of hope and life over the powersof despair and death.
title: Fantasia
